title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: ' Confess now, Sheila, Strathbraan is far bonnier than Glenquaich,'  said Alastair teasingly ; but Sheila shook her head.

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: ' What do you suppose is to become of Macleod, Sheila ? It won't be very easy for him to settle down in Strathbraan as a

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: In five years there'll not be your marrow in Glenquaich or Strathbraan.

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: The hawthorn bloom had been thick and white in Strathbraan all through the summer, and the haws ruddy on the boughs later on, and they had not belied their

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: A backward summer had made a late harvest in Strathbraan and Glenquaich, and the cottars in Achnafauld, whose crofts stood on the damp, cold soil at the top of Loch Fraochie, were like to have a poor return for their labour.

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: They were not beloved in Glenquaich and Strathbraan, and Graham Macdonald was a hard landlord, exacting his dues to the uttermost farthing; a just man, but not generous, that was all that could be said of him.

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: But the vicissitudes of war and the fickleness of fortune had wrested these from it It was only after the rebellion of '45 that Dalmore, in Glenquaich,  and Eindowie, in Strathbraan the present estates of the Macdonalds came into the possession of the family.
